pymdp.mdp.default_policy(mdp)[source]¶

Returns an arbitrary policy, which assigns to each state some available action.

Policy functions will be implemented as dictionaries. So if x is a state of the MDP, then policy[x] yields the action associated with the stationary policy for x.

Note that the default policy requires there to be an available action at every state.

pymdp.mdp.default_value(mdp)[source]¶

Returns the “zero” value function, which assigns to each state the value 0.0

Value functions will be implemented as dictionaries. So if x is a state of the MDP, then value[x] yields the value function at x.
